About

My coding journey began in 2020 when I creating an Autohotkey script to add control + a to Quickbooks Desktop. I soon began utilizing more of AHK and eventually JS in the Google Scripts environment. These early projects centered around my work as operations manager for a small business in the home improvment industry.

  • Sheets to Calendar: Navigating between the QB, Calendar, and Sheets user interfaces is slow and mistake-prone. I created an AHK script to pull CSV reports from QB for manual manipulation. This data could then be uploaded to a shared calendar. These set of tools eliminated simple human error when transferring lots of similar dates and numbers.
  • Margin Calendar: Determining a final price for a product is tricky, especially while in front of a customer. Vendor-specific surcharges, shipping, material type, and customer tier needs to be factored into the final markup. I created a simple calulator UI with AHK that makes it efficient for salespeople to arrive at the final price quickly.

These tools and similar ones I created in this position allowed me to spend far less time communicating reliable data to accounting, the designer, and the customer. However, the Google Script ecosystem kept me largly unaware of the DOM or working with the app APIs under the hood.

Projects

songbird52.com

  • Goal: A static webpage advertising local, solo guitar performance.
  • Outlier Issue: The media the provided was hosted on Facebook and the client's profile was not relevent to his buisiness. I migrated them off Facebook and hosted them in an Amazon S3 bucket.
